nodes.text: CASE 2: What about if you disagreed with how much the government is taxing you. Lets say your tax rate is 25% but you thought that was too much, would you just pay the amount you felt was fair?
I don't know if you ever heard of the UK Poll Tax but I could have seen myself protesting by non-payment against such a grotesquely unfair system of taxation had I been of the age to do so.

As I've stated in the other thread, I'm not a judge and I wouldn't rule on this. Life is not a simple matter of black and white, cut and dried answers. There can be extenuating circumstances--if you have the intelligence to get to understanding that point.

I think it is more cut and dry than you think. Some of us have a higher law than the US code. You might have a similiar hierachy of how you go about deciding right and wrong. A difference might be that my wants are below the law while your wants are above the law...would this be a fair representation? (note: I don't mean 'above the law' as to imply that you think you are mightier than everyone)
